title: Jens Stoltenberg | Prime Minister of Norway & NATO Secretary-General | Britannica

quotes: continued to prosper, and by 2013 the Government Pension Fund had swelled to some $750 billion.
a restive Norwegian electorate rejected Stoltenberg’s government in parliamentary elections in September 2013.
Conservative leader Erna Solberg became the first prime minister from her party since 1990.
Stoltenberg remained head of the Labour Party, and in March 2014 he was selected to succeed Anders Fogh Rasmussen as secretary-general of NATO.
that June the party convened to choose his longtime ally Jonas Gahr Støre to replace him.
Stoltenberg took the helm at NATO in October 2014, at a time when the alliance faced some of its greatest challenges since the end of the Cold War.

Stoltenberg would be the second-longest serving secretary-general in NATO history, and his 10-year term heralded a reinvigoration of the alliance. He oversaw the accession of new members Montenegro (2017) and North Macedonia (2020), and worked to enhance the readiness of NATO forces.

by the end of Trump’s term in 2021, the U.S. troop presence in Europe was almost entirely unchanged.
After Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2024, Stoltenberg remarked that NATO was undergoing ‘the biggest overhaul of our collective deterrence and defense since the Cold War.’

Russia’s forcible annexation of the Ukrainian autonomous republic of Crimea, its stoking of a pro-Russian insurgency in southeastern Ukraine, and its increasingly assertive military posture in the Baltic region returned NATO’s focus to eastern Europe and renewed members’ interest in collective defense.
After Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2024, Stoltenberg remarked that NATO was undergoing ‘the biggest overhaul of our collective deterrence and defense since the Cold War.’

Stoltenberg would be the second-longest serving secretary-general in NATO history, and his 10-year term heralded a reinvigoration of the alliance. He oversaw the accession of new members Montenegro (2017) and North Macedonia (2020), and worked to enhance the readiness of NATO forces.

Stoltenberg would be the second-longest serving secretary-general in NATO history, and his 10-year term heralded a reinvigoration of the alliance. He oversaw the accession of new members Montenegro (2017) and North Macedonia (2020), and worked to enhance the readiness of NATO forces.

Although U.S. Pres. Donald Trump had questioned the relevance of NATO and even discussed withdrawing the United States from the alliance, by the end of Trump’s term in 2021, the U.S. troop presence in Europe was almost entirely unchanged.
